intro: Psorospermum pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a glossy appearance.
